FYI

Due to strong winds and numerous fires in Southern California, the above campuses are closed today.

San Jacinto, college officials discuss addition of fire station, academy/PE

Friday, October 19th, 2007

http://www.pe.com/localnews/inland/stories/PE_News_Local_H_hmeet19.fd0de9.html#

“City and college officials agreed Thursday to explore a financial partnership to build a new fire station on the San Jacinto campus of Mt. San Jacinto College and operate a regional fire academy there.”

“If we could turn it into a regional training program, maybe the next fire station could become our laboratory.” Ann Motte

Blog:

A joint partnership with the City of San Jacinto could take the college’s existing fire science program to the next level by making the new fire station the fire science program’s laboratory, turning the project into a regional training facility. The City could purchase 50 of the 200 required points on the project with 50% funding for a project that would have cost them 100%. A good use of both state and taxpayer dollars.

Share This

Posted in Ann Motte, News | No Comments »

Former college interim president seeks damages/NC Times

Friday, October 19th, 2007

http://www.nctimes.com/articles/2007/10/19/news/californian/21_36_5310_18_07.txt

“Richard Giese is seeking damages that he contends resulted from the public release of an audit that shows he earned more money than allowed under his state retirement plan.”

The article states that “In Giese’s claim, his attorney alleged that trustees violated both state and federal laws by releasing to the public a confidential personnel record concerning Dr. Giese that had been reviewed by the Board of Trustees in one of its closed session meetings.”

Note:

It was not a “confidential personnel record”. It is a CalSTRS State Audit Report. The Confidential Appendix in the audit has never been released to the public. The college agreed with all findings in the audit.

San Gorgonio Pass Republican Women Federated/Speakers Forum

Thursday, October 18th, 2007

FYI

The San Gorgonio Pass Republican Women Federated will meet at 10 a.m. Wednesday at Calimesa Country Club, 1300 Third St., Calimesa. Guest speakers include Sandy Butler, executive director of the Riverside County Republican Party, Greg Barker and Gene Kadow. Reservations and information: 951-845-5301.
